Module com.calendarfx.app
Package com.serenitask.controller

Class RoutineTwoController

java.lang.Object
com.serenitask.controller.RoutineTwoController
public class RoutineTwoController extends Object
Class representing Routine 1 of the Optimizer pipeline. This routine handles the allocation of goals that require x time per repeating period y.

  • Constructor Details

    • RoutineTwoController

      public RoutineTwoController(LocalTime dayStart, LocalTime dayEnd, int allocationThreshold)
      Constructor for RoutineTwo, Represents the complex routine used for allocating balanced health focused habits.
      Parameters:
      dayStart - LocalTime object representing the Start of users day
      dayEnd - LocalTime object representing the End of users day

  • Method Details

    • runRoutine

      public void runRoutine(com.calendarfx.model.CalendarSource mainSource)
      Simple execution function that executes routine 2 of the optimizer. This routine handles the minimum ratio required for work:health is above the required amount. For every 4 hours of work there must be 30 minutes of health based activity.
      Parameters:
      mainSource - Calendar Source Object containing all calendars

    • improveDays

      private List<com.calendarfx.model.Entry<?>> improveDays(List<Day> days)
      Complex function used to improve a day object by inject health based activities into it to achieve a target level of balance
      Parameters:
      days - List of Day objects
      Returns:
      List of entries to be added to calendar

    • getHealthEvent

      private String getHealthEvent(int index)
      Draws a random health based event from a list of possible events.
      Parameters:
      index - Integer used for retrieving random event
      Returns:
      String object containing health based event name

    • checkRatio

      private boolean checkRatio(Day day)
      Computes the ratio between work and health based activities. For every 4 hours of work, there should be 30 minutes of health based activities
      Parameters:
      day - Day object representing a single day
      Returns:
      Boolean, true if day needs more health activities, false if balanced.

    • prepareDays

      private List<Day> prepareDays(List<List<Event>> rawDaysLists, LocalDate date)
      Takes in a List of Lists containing events sorted by day. Uses events per day to evaluate available TimeWindows available for allocation. Each list of events is converted to a Day which contains a List of Windows.
      Parameters:
      rawDaysLists - List of lists containing events, sorted by date
      date - Localdate object representing starting date of allocation
      Returns:
      List of Day objects

    • appendEvents

      private Day appendEvents(Day day, List<Event> events)
      Appends event duration values to either health or work based tallies
      Parameters:
      day - Day object representing a day
      events - List of events for the given day
      Returns:
      Returns updated Day object
